node.title: Genre-Blurring, Politically Charged Opera Wins Top Music Prize
node.description: Olga Neuwirth’s “Orlando,” an adaptation of Virginia Woolf that jolted a conservative opera house, received the $100,000 Grawemeyer Award.

node.title: No Matter the Role, Antony Sher Made Soaring Seem Possible
node.description: The actor, who died at the age of 72, was known for his commanding performances of Shakespeare’s Richard III and the Auschwitz survivor Primo Levi.

node.title: Donald Trump’s media company deal is being investigated by securities regulators.
node.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission and the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority are scrutinizing the agreement to go public by merging with a so-called blank-check company.

node.title: Super Cute Pink Anglerfish With Frowny Face Filmed on Bottom of Ocean
node.description: The Chaunacops was filmed during a Nautilus Live exploration of the Papahānaumokuākea Marine National Monument.

node.title: Chinese Rover Spots Weird 'Cube' on the Moon, Plans to Take a Closer Look
node.description: The blurry cube was spotted from a distance and may well just be a lump of rock. Of course, Twitter thinks it could be aliens.

node.title: Nearly Every State Has 70 Percent of ICU Beds or More in Use as COVID Cases Climb
node.description: Rhode Island and New Mexico currently have the highest percentage of ICU beds in use, with 92 percent and 90 percent, respectively, according to data from HHS.

node.title: This Seafood Stew Is Endlessly Riffable
node.description: No matter what ingredients you use, this bold, briny stew from David Tanis sings alongside a radicchio-fennel salad and a grapefruit granita.

node.title: Federal Scrutiny of Cuomo Widens to His Office’s Treatment of Women
node.description: The Justice Department opened an inquiry into reports of sexual harassment and retaliation in the former governor’s administration.

node.title: Scandal-Shaken Austria Gets Its 3rd Chancellor This Year
node.description: Karl Nehammer, the former interior minister, becomes the country’s leader two months after the resignation of Sebastian Kurz, amid an investigation into corruption and influence-peddling.

node.title: Scientists Find Mussels Thought to Be Over 100 Years Old in Wisconsin River
node.description: The scientists found a cluster of old spectaclecase mussels—a species native to the United States that is now endangered.

node.title: Kentucky representative faces criticism for family's gun photo
node.description: Representative Thomas Massie is facing criticism for sharing the post in the wake of a school shooting​ in Michigan.

node.title: Kennedy Center Honors return, in full swing
node.description: Singer and actress Bette Midler, Motown founder Berry Gordy, folk singer-songwriter Joni Mitchell, "Saturday Night Live" creator Lorne Michaels, and opera singer Justino Diaz are honored.

node.title: Restaurant Apologizes for Turning Away Armed Officers: 'We Made a Mistake'
node.description: Hilda and Jesse, a trendy restaurant in San Francisco, initially defended its decision to ask the officers to leave, saying their weapons made staff feel uncomfortable.

node.title: This Chemical Is in Short Supply, and the Whole World Feels It
node.description: Farmers in India are desperate. Trucks in South Korea had to be idled. Food prices, already high, could rise even further.

node.title: $1.5 Million Homes in California
node.description: A Colonial Revival home in Sacramento, a two-bedroom apartment in San Francisco and a 1948 ranch house in Altadena.

node.title: Max Rose to Run for House in Likely Rematch Against Malliotakis
node.description: Mr. Rose, a moderate Democrat, lost to Representative Nicole Malliotakis, a Republican, by six percentage points last year in a conservative district that includes Staten Island.

node.title: N.Y.C. companies that don’t rely on the global supply chain are faring quite well.
node.description: By Alyson Krueger

node.title: Andrzej Sikora, Who Allegedly Sheltered Ethan Crumbley Parents, Might Be Charged: Police
node.description: Oakland County resident Andrzej Sikora is linked to the studio where the parents of the 15-year-old accused Michigan school shooter were discovered following a lengthy manhunt.

node.title: Vaccine Requirement for Kids to Enter NYC Restaurants Among Strict New COVID Restrictions
node.description: New York's mayor also announced a "first-in-the-nation" vaccine mandate for all private sector workers.

node.title: Police shoot alleged gunman in Brisbane, ending six-hour siege
node.description: A man who was allegedly armed with a gun is hospitalised with serious injuries after a six-hour siege in Brisbane's south.

node.title: BuzzFeed’s first day as a public company is a test for other digital media groups.
node.description: The move is a “means to an end” for BuzzFeed to grow via acquisitions and e-commerce, its chief executive said.

node.title: Another Golden State Stimulus?
node.description: California is expected to have a huge budget surplus next year, which means state officials will probably have to return money to taxpayers.

node.title: New York City sets sweeping vaccine mandate for all private employers.
node.description: Mayor Bill de Blasio described the measure as a “pre-emptive strike” designed to stall another wave of coronavirus cases and help reduce transmission of the Omicron variant.

node.title: Detroit Lions dedicate first win to victims of school shooting
node.description: "Those names, for all those will never be forgotten and they're in our hearts and our prayers," Lions head coach Dan Campbell said.

node.title: A cruise ship returns to New Orleans with 17 Covid cases aboard.
node.description: The Norwegian Cruise Line ship, carrying more than 3,200 people, made stops in Belize, Honduras and Mexico. A crew member probably has the Omicron variant, health officials said.

node.title: China threatens 'firm countermeasures' if US conducts diplomatic boycott of Winter Olympics
node.description: Beijing says it would be "outright political provocation" for the US to fail to send officials to the Games as part of a protest against China's human rights record.

node.title: Omicron COVID-19 variant found in 12 states
node.description: The biggest question is whether current, available vaccines will prevent severe cases spread by the Omicron variant.

node.title: U.S. Opens Civil Rights Investigation Into Police in New York Suburb
node.description: The inquiry will focus on whether the Mount Vernon department engaged in a “pattern or practice of unlawful policing,” officials said.

node.title: Indonesia Volcanic Eruption Aftermath Video Shows Villages Covered in Ash As 15 Dead
node.description: The eruption caused mudflows that buried houses and vehicles in surrounding villages.

node.title: Teen Who Survived Crocodile Attack Was Convinced She Would Lose Her Foot
node.description: Amelie Osborn-Smith, 18, reflected on the attack: "Your life can be over so quickly."
